description: Redevelopment of site by erection of 1 no. part two, three and four storey building with lighthouse features (5922 m2 floorspace) and 1 no. three storey building (2160 m2 floorspace) with external staircases, for self storage purposes (B8), together with associated parking, servicing and areas for landscaping, and with vehicular ingress  from Greenford Road and egress to Cowgate Road
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonize with the surroundings. | Details of refuse storage in accordance with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority shall be submitted to and shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to the commencement of the scheme. Such provision as may be approved shall be brought into use at the first occupation of the development permitted and shall thereafter be retained permanently.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area. | No development shall take place until full details of both hard and soft landscaping works, including a phased programme of works, have been submitted to and have been approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority.  Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  REASON: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area.	 | No development shall take place until there has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority a plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment to be erected.  The boundary treatment as is approved shall be completed before the development approved is first occupied. Development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details only, and shall thereafter be retained.   REASON: To protect the amenity of the area. | Details of any external lighting demonstrating compliance with the recommendations of the Institute of Lighting Engineers "Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution" and the provisions of BS 5489 Part 9, must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority before the development approved is commenced. The lighting as approved must be installed prior to the first bringing use of the site for the purposes approved, and shall thereafter be maintained in accordance with these standards.   REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers in the vicinity, and ensure that highway safety is not prejudiced. | Before any works commence on site, details of a scheme to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with adopted standards shall be submitted to and shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, and such details as maybe approved shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation, and shall thereafter be retained.  REASON: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists. | Any machinery and equipment audible outside the premises (including mechanical ventilation systems) must be designed to satisfy an acoustic standard not exceeding NR35 Leq (5mins), 2300-0700hrs and NR40 Leq (1hr) 0700-2300 hrs, measured or calculated at 1m from the nearest fatade of the nearest affected noise sensitive premises.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers | Details of a suitable noise barrier at the boundary with residential premises in the space between the two proposed buildings, with a sufficient overlap between the buildings, shall be submitted to demonstrate that the noise level in LAMAX (fast) satisfies the following criteria:  1 - not greater  than 10dBA above the existing background LA90 (1 hour) noise level at 3.5m from a dwelling facade overlooking a garden or 1m from a dwelling fatade overlooking a balcony, (0700 to 2300hrs) 2 - not greater than 10 dB(A) above the existing background LA90 (1hour) noise level, at 1m outside a bedroom window, at the nearest facade of the nearest affected dwelling, (2300 to 0700hrs).   REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers. | The use hereby permitted, including any access to the premises by customers/ clients, shall not operate outside 0700 to 2300 hours seven day a week.   REASON: In the interests of the amenity of nearby properties. | No vehicles in excess of 17 tonnes shall be permitted to access the site at any time.  REASON:  In the interest of the amenity of neighbouring residential properties. | A sign shall be displayed close to the position of egress from the site onto Cowgate Road directing exiting traffic to turn right only. In addition, the full details of the egress shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Committee prior to the commencement of the development. The submitted details shall be such that larger vehicles will be physically prevented from being able to turn left on egressing the site.  The details as are agreed shall be implemented as agreed before the storage use is first brought into use.    REASON:  In the interest of the amenity of neighbouring residential properties in the local area. | Details shall be submitted of the security arrangements for the site to include appropriate arrangements for the eastern boundary.  REASON:  In the interest of the security and amenity of both occupiers of the development and of neighbouring properties. | There shall be no lighting emanating from inside any "lighthouse" features within the site.  REASON:  In the interest of neighbouring amenity and highway safety. | The premises shall be used for self storage only and not for any other purpose including for any other storage type use within Class B8 of the Town and Country Planning ( Use Classes ) Order 1987.  REASON:  In order that the Local Planning Authority can maintain adequate control over the nature of the use within the site. | All storage shall be confined to within the buildings only.  REASON:  In the interest of visual amenity and the satisfactory operation of the site.
